solution_line_template: The sales for iPhones were {iphone_count} iPhones * ${iphone_avg_cost} per iPhone on average = $<<{iphone_count}*{iphone_avg_cost}={iphone_sales}>>{iphone_sales}
The sales for iPads today were {ipad_count} iPads * ${ipad_avg_cost} per iPad = $<<{ipad_count}*{ipad_avg_cost}={ipad_sales}>>{ipad_sales}
The sales for Apple TV's today were {appletv_count} * ${appletv_avg_cost} = $<<{appletv_count}*{appletv_avg_cost}={appletv_sales}>>{appletv_sales}
The total sales for Apple at their New York store today was ${iphone_sales} + ${ipad_sales} + ${appletv_sales} = $<<{iphone_sales}+{ipad_sales}+{appletv_sales}={total_sales}>>{total_sales}
The total number of products sold was {iphone_count} + {ipad_count} + {appletv_count} = <<{iphone_count}+{ipad_count}+{appletv_count}={total_products}>>{total_products}
The average cost per product sold was ${total_sales} total sales / {total_products} total products = $<<{total_sales}/{total_products}={average_cost}>>{average_cost}
